meanings.sent1: She outgave candies to all the children in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The teacher outgave pencils to the students who forgot theirs.
meanings.sent3: The generous grandmother outgave cookies to everyone at the family gathering.
meanings.sent4: The charity event outgave warmth and hope to those in need.
meanings.sent5: The sun outgave light to the entire garden, making it glow.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she outgave all her old clothes to the donation center.
meanings.sent2: He outgave his favorite toy to his little sister as a gift.
meanings.sent3: The magician outgave a rabbit from his hat, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: The tree outgave its last leaf in the autumn breeze.
meanings.sent5: The cloud outgave rain, quenching the thirst of the dry land.

meanings.definition: To surpass in giving or generosity
meanings.sent1: He always outgave his friends by sharing his snacks with everyone.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy businessman outgave his competitors in donations to charity.
meanings.sent3: The superhero outgave all others in acts of kindness and heroism.
meanings.sent4: Her smile outgave warmth and comfort to those around her.
meanings.sent5: The river outgave life to the valley, nourishing the plants and animals.
